unnormalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) announced significant updates regarding the National Highway network across India on 20/07/2024. A key focus is the expansion of the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, expected to reduce travel time by approx. 12 hours.
normalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (M-o-R-T-H) announced significant updates regarding the National Highway network across India on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four. A key focus is the expansion of the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, expected to reduce travel time by approximately twelve hours.

unnormalised: The project, costing â‚¹1,00,000 crore, aims to improve connectivity between major industrial and commercial hubs. MoRTH officials confirmed that 80% of the expressway is now complete, with the remaining stretch expected to be operational by 31/12/2024. The expressway will feature advanced traffic management systems & rest stops every 50 km.
normalised: The project, costing rupee one hundred thousand crore, aims to improve connectivity between major industrial and commercial hubs. M-o-R-T-H officials confirmed that eighty percent of the expressway is now complete, with the remaining stretch expected to be operational by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. The expressway will feature advanced traffic management systems and rest stops every fifty kilometer.

unnormalised: Additionally, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has launched a campaign to improve road safety across the nation. The initiative includes stricter enforcement of traffic rules and installation of speed cameras on NH-44 and other major highways. The NHAI aims to reduce accidents by 20% within the next 6 months.
normalised: Additionally, the National Highways Authority of India (N-H-A-I) has launched a campaign to improve road safety across the nation. The initiative includes stricter enforcement of traffic rules and installation of speed cameras on N-H- forty four and other major highways. The N-H-A-I aims to reduce accidents by twenty percent within the next six months.

unnormalised: "These upgrades are crucial for boosting economic growth and ensuring safer travel for all citizens," stated a senior MoRTH official. Future plans involve the development of charging infrastructure for electric vehicles along major national highways. A pilot project is planned for the Chennai-Bangalore highway beginning 15th August '24.
